Job Description & Summary
To solve important problems we need to aim for the inclusion of our diverse talent. We empower our people to use their creativity, authenticity and human differences to be the champions of change. We know that when people from diverse backgrounds and with different points of view work together, we create the most value - for our clients, our people and our society. If you don’t think you quite meet all of the qualifications, we’d still love to hear from you.
About Us
Today’s world isn’t simple. The challenges facing business and society are complex. At PwC, we’ve created ‘The New Equation’ as our global strategy to address the breadth and complexity of challenges facing businesses and society. We’re combining everything we offer in new, creative ways. This builds trust, delivers sustained outcomes and helps clients solve their most important problems.
We know those challenges need to be looked at from a new angle. With your human ingenuity, passion and experience combined with the latest technology, these problems become easier to tackle. Together, we are a passionate community of solvers coming together in unexpected ways, creating new solutions for a new day.
We’re in the business of transformation. To transform the future, we're building a diverse, ambitious team who strive for imaginative ways of solving our clients' most important challenges. You'll get to work with the latest technologies, in an environment that empowers you to think differently.
You’ll help build technology solutions to help transform Australian businesses and governments, to create value and improve the way they work. As a Cloud ServiceNow Developer, you’ll add value to our projects by configuring and developing cloud applications, extensions and integrations that tie together the enterprise solutions that we deliver for our clients.
As part of the opportunity, you’ll have access to professional development and technical upskilling that is all about helping you thrive. You’ll work with inspiring people, join a culture driven to make a difference and develop your skills as you help us to solve important problems. With paid study leave, flexible working and other benefits, you’ll have the freedom to create a career that grows as you do.
Our Digital Transformation team empowers our clients to innovate and use technology in new ways and ensure that important organisational, business and operational improvements are made effectively. Using your logical thinking, passion in all things digital & tech, and growth mindset, a career with PwC will provide you with the opportunity to focus on the joint business relationship between PwC ServiceNow platforms to bring new and innovative services to some of the largest companies. We help our clients adopt the cloud to transform Information Technology, scale and streamline operations and create new cloud based businesses through our strong alliances. You’ll be at the forefront of helping organisations around the globe adopt innovative technology solutions that optimise business processes or enable scalable technology.
In joining, you’ll be part of cross functional delivery teams that help our clients implement cloud computing solutions that enable them in solving their most important business problems.
How and where work gets done is being reimagined. It all adds up to The New Equation.
Responsibilities
As a Cloud ServiceNow Developer in our Skilled Service Hub, your impact will be seen in our team by:
Understand business requirements and accordingly develop configuration specifications
Provide technical support for system design, testing and build activities
Analyse and remediate system defects
Recommend system enhancements based on CX value or performance uplift
Work with QA team to understand acceptance criterion and use cases
Handle deployment of builds
Work with Tech Leads, cloud engineers and developers to troubleshoot deployment failures in a timely manner
Understanding of development best practices and are capable of deploying services within and across the various platforms.
Demonstrating experience in the delivery of technical configuration of business needs
Working with a globally connected modern and agile team to tailor outcomes that address our clients’ requirements

Requirements
You’re in your final year of university, recently graduated or completed a relevant TAFE certificate/diploma in Computer Sciences, Engineering, IT or an edge-technology field. Passionate about technology, you have an interest in developing technical solutions to defined problems and keep at the forefront of all things tech. More importantly, you’re keen and willing to learn to succeed in your role.
Ideally but not required, is an understanding of common front-end and back-end technologies, development methods and programming languages that may include:
JavaScript
REST, SOAP, ODATA
Git and GitHub
React, Python, NodeJS, Java or any other language compatible in Cloud Foundry
Event driven architecture
Jenkins
Kubernetes
You understand the basic concept of cloud computing, and you understand how data is integrated using APIs/interfaces. You would also ideally be familiar with the basic concepts of the software development lifecycle and Agile methodologies.
You’re someone who enjoys working in a collaborative environment, connecting with teams across the country via modern workplace technologies. You’re keen to learn, to take up opportunities to improve your craft and continuously work towards the success of our clients.
Lastly, you’re collaborative and enjoy working in an innovative environment. You’re a problem solver by nature and want to join a firm that values the kind of people who reimagine the possible for their clients and stakeholders. Most importantly, you act with integrity and show care for the people you work with.
Your New Benefits
Flexible daily working hours, we value work-life balance
Work overseas or interstate, we know how precious time is with your family and friends
Paid study (and leave!), we’ll pay all the costs and give you time off to study
No dress code, wear what makes you feel comfortable and dress for your day
Yearly bonuses, because who doesn’t love to be rewarded for great performance!
Health & fitness perks, like a wellness stipend and discounted memberships
Generous parental leave policy for mums, dads and foster carers

About Us

Fivecast is a world-leading provider of digital intelligence solutions. We enable the world’s most important public and private organizations to explore masses of data and uncover actionable insights, critical to protecting global communities.

Fivecast is an inclusive employer, we value diversity of thought and experience, and we believe our inclusive culture contributes to our success. We are committed to building a workforce that is representative of the communities in which we live and work.

As a growing start-up, all team members are provided with the opportunity to directly contribute to our success, participate in the development of new and emerging technologies and grow their careers in a challenging and dynamic high-tech environment.

About the Role

The Product Marketing Manager will be an integral member of the global Fivecast Marketing team, supporting the execution of the global marketing plan and helping to drive awareness, lead generation and revenue growth for Fivecast across our customer base in national security, defence, law enforcement and corporate security.

This role requires experience in content creation, messaging and positioning and working with product and sales teams to successfully launch solutions to the market. Success in this role requires the ability to work cross-functionally across organizational teams including product management, development, tradecraft, data science and sales; excellent written and verbal communications skills; a keen customer focus; and the ability to execute in a fast-paced environment.

Key Responsibilities:

Supporting the go-to-market (GTM) releases of new Fivecast solutions and use cases:
Work with the product management team to understand the key features and value of new solutions and use cases
Research our customer base and the broader market to understand customer needs, buying patterns and identify opportunities for Fivecast to create demand
Create messaging & positioning documents that reflect Fivecast capabilities and market opportunities
Plan and execute on the product content, sales enablement, GTM demand gen activities required to ensure market traction and success

Creating product Marketing content – produce high quality, product-focused content that communicates Fivecast messaging and differentiators including:
Solution & Industry briefs
Customer case studies
Product presentations
Blogs
Webinar content
Competitive battlecards

Conducting sales enablement in conjunction with Product Management and Tradecraft teams:
Train sales teams on the messaging, positioning and competitive differentiators for Fivecast solutions that will help expedite sales cycles
Assist with competitive analysis and ensuring Fivecast differentiatiors are understood by Sales and reflected in content

Contribute to other global marketing and demand generation initiatives as required:
Support Fivecast presence at Industry Conferences with presentation materials and other content
Help to define topics and themes for thought leadership marketing campaigns and assist in producing content for campaigns including webinars, white papers, blogs and case studies

Experience
4 to 8 years’ experience in a software product marketing role
Experience working cross-functionally with product and sales teams to launch new solutions into new markets
Proven ability to create content that translates technical concepts into value-focused messaging that resonates with customers
Excellent inter-personal and communication skills (both verbal and written)
Self-motivated, able to work autonomously and manage projects to completion
Bachelor’s degree in Marketing
Experience in B2B Software Product Marketing
Our Work Environment and Culture

Only a few minutes from the city, Fivecast is located at Base 64 on North Terrace, home to other innovative and interesting Australian technology start-ups. Enjoy a casual, relaxed atmosphere that encourages collaboration and includes a fully equipped kitchen, barista-quality coffee machine, end of trip facilities, and comfortable indoor and outdoor spaces for meetings and eating. At Fivecast we understand the importance of a good work-life balance and support flexible work arrangements.

Job Description & Summary
To solve important problems we need to aim for the inclusion of our diverse talent. We empower our people to use their creativity, authenticity and human differences to be the champions of change. We know that when people from diverse backgrounds and with different points of view work together, we create the most value - for our clients, our people and our society. If you don’t think you quite meet all of the qualifications, we’d still love to hear from you.
About Us
Today’s world isn’t simple. The challenges facing business and society are complex. At PwC, we’ve created ‘The New Equation’ as our global strategy to address the breadth and complexity of challenges facing businesses and society. We’re combining everything we offer in new, creative ways. This builds trust, delivers sustained outcomes and helps clients solve their most important problems.
We know those challenges need to be looked at from a new angle. With your human ingenuity, passion and experience combined with the latest technology, these problems become easier to tackle. Together, we are a passionate community of solvers coming together in unexpected ways, creating new solutions for a new day.
We’re in the business of transformation. To transform the future, we're building a diverse, ambitious team who strive for imaginative ways of solving our clients' most important challenges. You'll get to work with the latest technologies, in an environment that empowers you to think differently.
Our Digital Transformation team empowers our clients to innovate and use technology in new ways and ensure that important organisational, business, and operational improvements are made effectively. Using your logical thinking, passion in all thing’s information digital & tech, combined with a growth mindset, a career with PwC will provide you with the opportunity to focus on the joint business relationship between PwC and the provision of innovative services to some of the largest companies and government clients.
How and where work gets done is being reimagined. It all adds up to The New Equation.
Responsibilities
In joining, you’ll support testing and quality strategies that help our clients implement cloud computing solutions to support their business needs.
As an Automation Engineer (Quality Analyst) in our Skilled Service Hub, your impact will be seen by:
Designing, building, and executing integration and configuration test cases across major technology platforms
Understanding of cloud best practices and can deploy services across multiple platforms in an agile and iterative fashion
Understanding the business specific requirements and analyzing functional impact and conducting test case reviews to check for adherence to testing standards
A strong attention to detail and quality in all that you do and how your approach meeting our clients’ needs
Demonstrating experience and understanding of best practice Quality Assurance in test design and execution and the latest developments in supporting toolset
Working with a globally connected modern and agile team to tailor outcomes that address our clients’ requirements
Requirements
You’re in your final year of uni, recently graduated or completed a relevant TAFE certificate/diploma in Computer Sciences, Engineering, IT, or an edge-technology field. You’re passionate about everything tech and its interaction with how business works. You’re naturally inquisitive, eager to take initiative, test ideas to find better ways of doing things, unafraid to try new approaches and can think holistically as you help us to solve important problems!
Ideally but not required, you understand the basic concept of cloud computing, and you understand how data is integrated using APIs/interfaces. You would also ideally be familiar with the basic concepts of the software development lifecycle and Agile methodologies.
Passionate about being at the forefront of change, you wish to constantly strive to maintain your understanding of the latest developments in cloud-based technology platforms to enable our firm to deliver meaningful value to clients.
You’re collaborative and enjoy working in an innovative environment. You’re a problem solver by nature and want to join a firm that values the kind of people who reimagine the possible for their clients and stakeholders. Most importantly, you act with integrity and show care for the people you work with.
Your New Benefits
Flexible daily working hours, we value work-life balance
Work overseas or interstate, we know how precious time is with your family and friends
Paid study (and leave!), we’ll pay all the costs and give you time off to study
No dress code, wear what makes you feel comfortable and dress for your day
Yearly bonuses, because who doesn’t love to be rewarded for great performance!
Health & fitness perks, like a wellness stipend and discounted memberships
Generous parental leave policy for mums, dads and foster carers

Asset Planner, Water Assets
About the Company:
SA Water is proud to deliver an important and essential service to 1.7 million customers every day. For more than 160 years, we have been working together with South Australians to ensure a reliable supply of safe, clean water services across the state, both regionally and locally.
About the role:
An exciting opening exists within our Asset Management team, offering the desired candidate the opportunity to join an organisation which heavily focuses on its provision of essential water services, customers satisfaction, broader community needs, and the assurance of continuity in the delivery of exceptional service.
The Asset Planner - Water Assets will contribute to the development and planning for Asset Management Plans for SA Water’s water assets, supporting their implementation to ensure agreed levels of service are provided that minimise risk, performance and life-cycle costs, while providing customer centric outcomes.
In an effort to deliver exceptional outcomes benefiting both the business, and our customers, the Asset Planner, Water Assets – with the collection and translation of a variety of performance data – will primarily focus on the effective management and performance of SA Water’s Cathodic Protection (CP) systems, ensuring assets support the efficiency of the delivery of essential water services.
Key Responsibilities:
Provide strategic direction for future requirements, demand analysis and forecasting, and develop effective Asset Approaches for the Water Assets, focusing on the management of CP systems performance.
Identify, appraise, optimise and prioritise options; and develop effective Asset Management Plans for the Water Assets.
Contribute to the appraisal, selection and justification of investment options and their alignment with overall corporate strategic objectives.
Implement Asset Management Plans through the delivery of asset lifecycle activities including the operation, maintenance, optimisation and rationalisation of assets.
Review the performance of operating, maintenance and capital interventions and identify where adjustment to asset management approaches and plans is required.
Acknowledge, understand and manage risk effectively for the water assets, including performance review and continuous improvement.
Define water assets information, including how the data is gathered, analysed, interpreted, managed and applied to support asset management decision making.
About the Person:
The successful candidate will demonstrate strong analytical skills, presenting the ability and agility to make strategic decisions based on large quantities of foreign data, ensuring findings are translated into tangible solutions while effectively and efficiently communicating on multi-disciplinary stakeholder levels.
With demonstrated stakeholder engagement, time-management, self-motivation, and organisation skills, the Asset Planner, Water Assets will apply their knowledge and expertise in asset management principals, providing timely evaluation, problem-solving and innovative, fit-for-purpose solutions for key stakeholders.
In addition, the Asset Planner – Water Assets will also require:
Qualifications in Engineering, Science, Asset Management, Trade based discipline or relevant applied experience (desirable)
Background in either Engineering, Finance/Commerce/Economics (within utilities or infrastructure) is desirable
Knowledge of infrastructure assets in water or wastewater systems, maintenance or operational activities (desirable)
Sound understanding and applied knowledge of Asset Management principles (desirable)
Analytical skills and demonstrated ability to assess, evaluate and innovatively solve problems when dealing with customer and other issues (essential)
Proven ability to communicate effectively both in writing and verbally, recognising diversity within preferred styles, on multi-disciplinary levels (essential)
A hands-on, results-driven, solution-focused approach
Benefits:
Attractive and competitive salary
Working with a company that values growth and support of its employees, customers, the wider community
Contributing to the sustainability of a significant, essential public service
Working for a highly reputable organisation
Backed by a supportive, inclusive, and value-aligned team culture
If you have a passion to work within a diverse, customer-centred business, filled with passionate and self-motivated people, where fresh thinking is valued and innovation is embraced, we want to hear from you. If you relish working in an evolving environment, have a desire to work collaboratively amongst a wealth of talent, partake in rewarding work with a purpose in an exciting industry, SA Water is a great place to be.

Work on Spacecraft development!
Subsystems ownership
Collaborate on Greenfield projects

The Company

Fleet Space Technologies is an innovative technology company that builds solutions for companies that wish to monitor and manage assets in remote areas. Our satellite constellation in combination with state-of-the-art ground-based technologies allows customers to securely transfer data from anywhere in the world.

As a business, we are ambitious, innovative, and collaborative and we put our customers first in everything that we do. We love celebrating our successes, and we have had a lot to celebrate to date. Over the past two years we have successfully built, deployed, and connected thousands of our customer's IoT devices to our nano-satellite backhaul enabling them to transfer data for tracking and managing their assets.

The Position

This role is a permanent position based primarily in our corporate head office located in Beverley, South Australia. To support our business, we are looking to employ a full-time Electronic Power Systems Engineer to join a dedicated engineering team, working on a range of products and reporting to our Head of Spacecraft Development; you will be required to ensure that the products/systems are successfully developed to meet the customer specifications as it was intended. You will have a strong ability to successfully analyse, qualify system integrations, validate, and verify the project's progress throughout the system life-cycle.

As a valued team member, you will be invited to participate in all company cultural activities and provide feedback in our monthly all hands meetings. This role offers great training and development opportunities as well as the opportunity to work in an innovative team environment.

Main Responsibilities
Responsible for design and development of electrical power sub-systems for satellite
Responsible for designing, testing, constructing, and operating electrical systems for satellite devices, including control and processing electronics
Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to develop prototypes and manufacture components
Collaboration with manufacturing engineers and suppliers to transition concepts to production
Delegate where necessary and review the work of others team members for technical accuracy and adequacy.
Support of manufacturing with drawings, bills of materials and qualification test plans
Assess risk and escalate and/or define appropriate measures to contain design defects, field problems or resource conflicts within the company.
Prepare and review technical reports
Key Skills and Experience
Deliver clear and concise communication, both written and verbal
Experience using mathematics software such as Matlab, Labview or MathCAD
Create and maintain production prints, assembly instructions, bills of material, and other documentation related to developed products
Generate procedural support documents and user manuals for developed products
Provide technical support and troubleshoot problems
Results driven and responsible
Ability to work in a fast paced, agile and autonomously driven atmosphere
A team player
Willingness to learn
Qualifications
Masters or Bachelor degree in Electrical, Mechanical Engineering; or Computer Science
5+ years of experience in a similar role
Fleet Space Technologies is an Equal Opportunity Employer; employment with Fleet Space Technologies is governed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications and will not be influenced in any manner by race, colour, religion, gender, national origin/ethnicity, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, mental or physical disability or any other legally protected status.

Distributed data storage at scale (Hadoop, Ceph)

Full Description
Location Sunraysia / MIA / SA Riverland
Intelligent technology making the future of farming more fruitful – and sustainable.
Protecting our planet’s ever diminishing resources
About the Company
Our mission is to help irrigators to achieve their economic and environmental goals by providing the world’s best irrigation and nutrient management tools. We achieve this through configurable water and nutrient management software that supports data-driven decision-making.
About the role
The purpose of the Territory Manager role is to grow sales of our client’s software products, and develop new, long-term client relationships within the Sunraysia and broader inland irrigated regions. The role will work closely with the national sales and marketing team, and reports to the CEO. In addition to the development of new business the role is responsible for the ongoing management of the existing territory client base.
Key Responsibilities
Client relations:
Create business development proposals for new opportunities.
Identify and grow opportunities within territory and collaborate with management to ensure growth attainment
Build and maintain strong, long-lasting client relationships
Ensure that software solutions achieve client needs and objectives in a timely and successful way.
Sales:
Work with the national sales and marketing team to identify leads
Reach out to leads identified to create brand awareness
Demonstrate software to prospects
Meet identified sales targets across the portfolio of our client’s software products within territory
Attend company meetings, field days, customer workshops, promotional activities as requested by management
Achieve relevant KPI’s as required by this position, and provide appropriate input to provide KPI data
Assist in maintaining appropriate company representation to the current and potential client base by providing input into the website, marketing/promotional materials, advertising media and direct client representation.
Assist in maintaining accurate customer details and records for CRM
Ensure product sales schedules are up to date
Requirements
Education / Experience / Skills
Demonstrated experience in a similar role
Tertiary qualification in Agricultural Science or equivalent
New business development and relationship management experience
Agronomic experience either via education or prior work experience
A background in horticultural farming, soil science, nutrition and irrigation Understanding of AgTech / the precision farming ecosystem
Drivers license + car
